posts.name: Sophia D.
posts.cooked:
Hey I’m trying to get a tank command based code working but I’m having trouble with getting it working. I’m sure it’s a very simple issue but I’m not catching it.

Here is the code:

Contribute to Sophia2282/Backupdrive development by creating an account on GitHub.

What kind of errors are you getting? if the code is failing to compile it is because you are trying to call a method on an object that doesn’t exist. Also your DriveTrain function isn’t being called any where. If you want a resource that will teach you through about the Command based structure you can look at WPI’s documentation:

Go through the pages until the end of “The Command Structure” to learn about how the structure works which will make it a lot easier to implement your drive subsystem.

WPILib supports a robot programming methodology called “command-based” programming. In general, “command-based” can refer both the general programming paradigm, and to the set of WPILib library res...

Once you do that if you are stuck reply to this message and I will be happy to help you when I get the chance!

link_counts.title: What Is “Command-Based” Programming? — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: Currently though there is a quick way to get your drive moving fast. All you need to do is in the constructor of RobotContainer set the default command of the DriveTrain. This can be done by passing in a run command, which is a command that calls a lambda, which is a function that can be stored, into the setDefaultCommand function of DriveTrain, which it inherits from SubsystemBase.

posts.name: Sophia D.
posts.cooked:
I’ve corrected most of the errors, though I’m not sure if it will work. At the moment I having trouble in the Drivetrain subsystem to add requirements; as well as I realized the command file tankdrive is not being used and I’m sure that’s an issue.

I’ve updated the code, would you be able to look over it again?

You don’t really need a command for your differential drive, differential drive is simple enough that it can just be a method which is where the run command comes in, however if you want to apply some things like slew limiting, it might be cleaner to implement it in a command. In the command you are need to pass a drive subsystem into its constructor and store the DriveTrain that gets passed in the class.

To get this to run you would then need to import this command into RobotContainer and set the default command for the DriveTrain subsystem. It is the only place you should specify a default command until you are very familiar with how the command based system works. It would look like this.

Something to note as you are fleshing out your code, it is easier to read code when you name classes like driveSubsystem, or tankDriveCommand. It may help you keep track of what is happening because you have the tankDrive method and the tankDriveCommand.

edit: Also you need to call the tankDrive method from the object m_driveTrain in the execute method of the command. You will also need to pass in and store a DoubleSupplier into tankDrive command. These do not need to go in the addRequirements function. Then in execute you would pass the values in by calling the getAsDouble() function on the double suppliers. In RobotContainer the constructor would need to look like this:

As I said earlier lambdas are basically just functions you can store. The parenthesis store arguments of lambda, so they are empty because the functions don’t need any arguments. The → basically just points towards the function body.

posts.name: Sophia D.
posts.cooked: I’m sorry to keep asking you questions and for advice. I currently have no errors but when trying to drive it still won’t drive. I think it has to do with my tankDrive command file, though I could most definitely be wrong. I used your advice along with following this . Another issue as well which you commented earlier on was the naming of classes and such.

The code in the drivetrain function in robot container needs to go in the constructor of RobotContainer. Above the calling of the configure button bindings. image 750×1334 156 KB

image 750×1334 156 KB

posts.name: Sophia D.
posts.cooked: I will try this in the morning. Thank you so much for helping me this late. Our competition is tomorrow and the drivecode we origianlly had didn’t work.
